data.name: While attempting to build, file #{0:X3} in archive {1} was found to be corrupt. Serial Loops can delete this file from your base directory automatically which may allow you to load the rest of the project, but any changes made to that file will be lost. Alternatively, you can attempt to edit the file manually to fix it. How would you like to proceed? Press OK to proceed with deleting the file and Cancel to attempt to deal with it manually.
data.value: While attempting to build, file #{0:X3} in archive {1} was found to be corrupt. Serial Loops can delete this file from your base directory automatically which may allow you to load the rest of the project, but any changes made to that file will be lost. Alternatively, you can attempt to edit the file manually to fix it. How would you like to proceed? Press OK to proceed with deleting the file and Cancel to attempt to deal with it manually.

data.value: Would you like to save your changes to the save file?

data.comment: A flag marking that the tutorial in question has been completed

data.comment: As in the group selection objectives

data.name: First Selection
data.comment: Indicates route was picked in the first group selection

data.name: Second Selection
data.comment: Indicates route was picked in the second selection

data.name: Level
data.comment: The level of a character power

data.name: Remaining Uses
data.comment: The uses remaining for this character power

data.name: Uses Since Level Up
data.comment: The number of times the power has been used since the last level up

data.name: Uses to Level Up
data.comment: The number of times the power must be used to level up

data.name: Export Layout Preview
data.comment: Button that exports a preview of the current layout item

data.name: Export Source Preview
data.comment: Button that exports a preview of the current source image of a particular layout entry

data.name: BG Layer
data.comment: Background Layer

data.name: BG Object Layer
data.comment: Background Object Layer (intermediate layer between background and object layers)

data.name: Scrolling BG
data.comment: The scrolling background used in the puzzle phase maps

data.name: Info Layer
data.comment: The layer of a map that contains information rather than actual graphics

data.name: BG Occlusion Layer
data.comment: Background Occlusion Layer (BG objects that should occlude everything else, i.e. should be drawn on top of even objects)

data.name: BG Junk Layer
data.comment: BG Junk Layer, i.e. stuff that's not displayed in-game but is stored in the maps

data.name: Draw Origin
data.comment: Draws the origin (i.e. coordinate 0,0) of the map

data.name: Draw Boundary
data.comment: Draws the bounds of the map

data.name: Object Junk Layer
data.comment: The map layer containing objects that aren't included in-game

data.name: Object Locations
data.comment: Locations of objects on the map (that can occlude or not)

data.name: Camera Trucking
data.comment: Refers to items defining camera movement at the beginning of the puzzle phase

data.name: Ignore Hash?
data.comment: This is in the project import dialog and indicates the ROM hash should be ignored

data.name: Error getting script command tree for script {0} ({1}): {2} {3}
data.value: Error getting script command tree for script {0} ({1}): {2} {3}
data.comment: {0} is the script display name, {1} is the script's underlying name, {2} is the command and {3} is the command's parameters

data.name: In order to edit this save file, Serial Loops needs to make a temporary project. However, a project called "{0}" already exists. Would you like to overwrite this project?
data.value: In order to edit this save file, Serial Loops needs to make a temporary project. However, a project called "{0}" already exists. Would you like to overwrite this project?

data.name: Symbols
data.comment: Refers to defined variables or functions in code

data.name: The hack file has been successfully created. To import it, open the ASM hacks dialog and select "Import Hack".
data.value: The hack file has been successfully created. To import it, open the ASM hacks dialog and select "Import Hack".

data.name: Note: When exporting an xdelta patch, the base ROM you should use is likely different than the one you used when creating the project. Please choose the base Japanese ROM (SHA-1 can be confirmed below) to ensure that people who want to play your hack only need to patch the game once.
data.value: Note: When exporting an XDelta patch, the base ROM you should use is likely different than the one you used when creating the project. Please choose the base Japanese ROM (SHA-1 can be confirmed below) to ensure that people who want to play your hack only need to patch the game once.

data.name: Please select a base ROM before attempting to create the XDelta patch!
data.value: Please select a base ROM before attempting to create the XDelta patch!

data.name: No path to XDelta file selected!
data.value: No path to XDelta file selected!

data.name: Please select a path to save the XDelta patch to before attempting to create it.
data.value: Please select a path to save the XDelta patch to before attempting to create it.

data.name: Open an item using the explorer to start editing!
data.value: Open an item using the explorer to start editing!

data.name: Normalize
data.comment: As in "normalize the audio volume so that max volume is similar to all other audio volumes"

data.name: Move 1
data.comment: As on a chessboard

data.name: Move 2
data.comment: As on a chessboard

data.name: There are no Serial Loops crash logs. No crashes so far!
data.value: There are no Serial Loops crash logs. No crashes so far!

data.name: Clear Move
data.comment: As in "delete a chess move"

data.name: Clear All Guides
data.comment: As in "delete all guide markers on the chess board"

data.name: Remove Talk Link
data.comment: Remove the association with a script section when you talk to this map character

data.name: Add Chibi
data.comment: ...to the current map

data.name: Are you sure you want to delete the map characters section?
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the map characters section?

data.name: InteractableObjectsAsmHackMessage
data.value: By default, the game ignores the IDs of these objects and applies them in order. To make this tooling more useful, we highly recommend applying the "Sensible Interactable Object Selection" hack by going to Tools → Apply ASM Hacks.

data.name: None
data.comment: Used in combo boxes when no item is selected

data.name: UnknownHackFailedMessage
data.value: A hack failed, but we weren't able to determine which one. Take a look at the logs for more information. All hacks have been rolled back to preserve state.

data.name: ReplaceAsAhx
data.comment: "AHX" refers to an audio encoding format (as opposed to ADX, the standard format) specifically designed to encode voice files

data.name: HelpAhx
data.value: AHX is the audio codec most of the voice files are encoded as as it's specifically designed to compress voice. However, our encoder can sometimes cause issues with the game, so we generally recommend encoding these lines with the standard ADX format. That said, if you encounter issues with the regular Replace, try using this option!

data.name: DialogueColorHeader
data.comment: {0} is the index of the particular color (1-16) in the dialogue color palette

data.name: ProjectDeleteConfirmText
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this project?

data.name: ProjectDeleteFailedText
data.value: Failed to move the project to the trash/recycle bin! Would you like to permanently delete the project instead? WARNING: This cannot be undone!

data.name: ProjectRenameDuplicateMustEnterNameErrorText
data.value: You must enter a name for the project!

data.name: ProjectAlreadyExistsErrorText
data.value: A project of that name already exists! Please choose a different name for your project.

data.name: ProjectDuplicatedSuccessText
data.value: Project successfully duplicated! Would you like to open it now?

data.name: ProjectDuplicatedFailureText
data.value: Failed to duplicated project. Please check the logs and file an issue if this is a recurring problem.

data.name: SdlExceptionTooManyDevicesText
data.value: Sorry, but you currently have too many sound items open to open another one. Please close some and then try again.

data.name: BgmAdjustVolumeError
data.value: Failed to adjust volume for background music. Please check the logs and file an issue if this reoccurs.

data.name: BgmLoopErrorMessage
data.value: Failed to adjust loop data for background music. Please check the logs and file an issue if this reoccurs.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeTEX_BG
data.value: A standard visual novel background used on the bottom screen, something that sprites would be displayed on top of. Displayed with BG_DISP or BG_FADE.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeKINETIC_SCREEN
data.value: A simple top-screen scrolling graphic, used in the base game to indicate time of day. Displayed with KBG_DISP.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeTEX_CG
data.value: A standard CG (character graphic) that displays a scene on the bottom screen. Sprites would not be placed on top of this. Displayed with BG_DISPCG or BG_FADE.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeTEX_CG_DUAL_SCREEN
data.value: A tall CG (character graphic) displayed across both screens. It is too tall to be viewed at once, so it can be scrolled up and down with BG_SCROLL. Displayed with BG_DISPCG.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeTEX_CG_WIDE
data.value: A wide CG (character graphic) displayed on the bottom screen. Can be scrolled left and right with BG_SCROLL. Displayed with BG_DISPCG.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpBgTypeTEX_CG_SINGLE
data.value: A tall CG (character graphic) displayed on the bottom screen only. It can be scrolled up and down with BG_SCROLL. Displayed with BG_DISPCG.

data.name: BackgroundEditorHelpCgName
data.value: The title of the CG as it will appear in the Extras mode's Album (CG viewer)

data.name: BgmEditorLoopInfoHelp
data.value: The audio format used by Chokuretsu encodes loop information into audio file itself, denoting where the track should loop from and to. Click this button to edit this information.

data.name: BgmEditorVolumeHelp
data.value: Click this button to adjust the volume of the track.

data.name: BgmVolumeNormalizeHelp
data.value: Click this to normalize the volume to match the default volume of all other tracks in the game. Recommended.

data.name: CharacterEditorVoiceFontHelp
data.value: The voice font is the sound effect that plays when there isn't a voiced line for this character (i.e. the little beeps)

data.name: CharacterEditorTextTimerHelp
data.value: The text timer represents how fast the character speaks. The higher the value, the slower the text will appear on screen.

data.name: ChibiEditorAnim97Help
data.value: Still pose for "good" group selection result

data.name: ChibiEditorAnim98Help
data.value: Still pose for "neutral" group selection result

data.name: ChibiEditorAnim99Help
data.value: Still pose for "bad" group selection result

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpNEW_GAME
data.value: This command defines where the "New Game" menu item takes the player. For example, if NEW_GAME 5 defines where selecting New Game → Episode 5 will take the player.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpSAVE
data.value: This command prompts the user to save the game, creating a checkpoint save. Typically, the first save in an episode is denoted by setting the parameter to 2 and incrementing it for each checkpoint after that.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpLOAD_SCENE
data.value: This command loads a particular script file.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpPUZZLE_PHASE
data.value: This command starts a particular puzzle phase.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpROUTE_SELECT
data.value: This command starts a particular group selection.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpSTOP
data.value: This command stops the game. It is not actually used.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpSAVE2
data.value: This command also prompts the user to save the game. While the precise mechanical differences between this and SAVE are not well understood, it is known that it is used after the UNLOCK command and before the NEW_GAME or END commands. This implies that it interacts more directly with the common save than do checkpoint saves. Its parameter is always 0.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpTOPICS
data.value: This command displays which topics the player has collected over the previous scene(s) following group selection.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpCOMPANION_SELECT
data.value: This loads a companion selection screen, allowing the player to select which Brigade member will accompany Haruhi during the puzzle phase.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpPLAY_VIDEO
data.value: Plays a video; 0 plays the OP and 1 plays the ED.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpUNLOCK_ENDINGS
data.value: This command unlocks a character ending scene based on the friendship levels. Used at the end of the game.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpUNLOCK
data.value: Unlocks particular functionality. The exact mapping between the parameter specified and which functionality is unlocked is currently unknown.

data.name: ScenarioVerbHelpEND
data.value: Ends the scenario and returns to the title screen.

data.name: SystemTextureReplaceHelp
data.value: Click this button to replace the texture WITHOUT changing the existing palette. This means that you will want to design the replacement to have the colors displayed below for maximum fidelity. We recommend using this option only if palette replacement is disabled.

data.name: SystemTextureReplaceWithPaletteHelp
data.value: Click this button to replace the texture AND the texture's palette. This will adapt the palette to match the new image you upload, preserving color as much as possible. If this option is available, we recommend using it.

data.name: SystemTexturePaletteReplacementDisabledChess
data.value: This system texture uses the common chess palette, so palette replacement has been disabled.

data.name: TopicTimesHelp
data.value: These times represent the amount of time gained in the puzzle phase when using this topic. The character accompanying Haruhi applies a percentage modifier to the base time gain to result in the amounts seen in-game and in the right-hand column.

data.name: TopicEditorHiddenIdHelp
data.value: All main topics have a second "hidden" ID in addition to their main one. This is displayed for internal accounting and is generally not interesting to you as a user.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_DISP
data.value: Displays a background image on the lower screen. The background image can only be of type TEX_BG.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_DISP2
data.value: The same as BG_DISP. Use that command instead.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_DISPCG
data.value: BG_DISPCG works as BG_DISP but can display a larger variety of textures – namely, TEX_CG, TEX_CG_DUAL_SCREEN, TEX_CG_WIDE, and TEX_CG_SINGLE BGs. Notably, these are all CGs as opposed to VN backgrounds. Before displaying a standard BG after calling BG_DISPCG, one should call BG_REVERT.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_FADE
data.value: Like the other BG display commands but crossfades the background rather than just displaying it.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_REVERT
data.value:
Reverts the background to the last call of BG_DISP (i.e. undoes any BG_FADE or BG_DISPCG calls). This is required before returning to displaying standard TEX_BG BGs. Note that if reverting a TEX_CG_DUAL_SCREEN BG, SET_PLACE must have been used to set the place location and have it displayed.
BG_REVERT does something odd to previously displayed CGs that makes attempting to display them again after the BG_REVERT crash/freeze/soft lock the game. If you need to go back and forth between the same CGs, consider using BG_FADE.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBG_SCROLL
data.value: When a background that is larger than the screen is shown (such as TEX_CG_DUAL_SCREEN, TEX_CG_WIDE, and TEX_CG_SINGLE), scrolls the background in a defined direction.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_LOAD
data.value: Loads a chess file into memory and (if the chess overlay is loaded) places it on the chessboard.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_MOVE
data.value: Moves a piece (or pieces) on the chessboard.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_RESET
data.value: Resets the chessboard to its original state.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_TOGGLE_CROSS
data.value: Crosses out spaces on the chessboard with a red X. If a space is already crossed out, this command uncrosses it out.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_TOGGLE_GUIDE
data.value: Highlights the potential moves of a piece in red. If a piece has already been highlighted, this command unhighlights it. Optionally, can specify to clear all guides currently on the board.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_TOGGLE_HIGHLIGHT
data.value: Highlights spaces on the chessboard in yellow. If a space is already highlighted, this command unhighlights it.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHESS_VGOTO
data.value: Monitors for the end of the chess game and then jumps to a specified script block depending on the outcome.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHIBI_EMOTE
data.value: Displays an emote in a speech bubble above a chibi figure on the top screen.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCHIBI_ENTEREXIT
data.value: Specifies a chibi figure to enter or exit the top screen. To be used by this command, a chibi must have a walk cycle (animation 01) in addition to its default idle animation (animation 00).

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpCONFETTI
data.value: Displays falling confetti on the top screen.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpDIALOGUE
data.value: Displays a line of dialogue and/or manipulates character sprites. Can optionally play a voiced line.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpEPHEADER
data.value: Sets the upper screen to be an episode title texture.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpGLOBAL2D
data.value: Sets a global variable to a specified value. Only used in one place so it's difficult to determine what it affects.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpGOTO
data.value: Jumps to a particular script section.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpHARUHI_METER
data.value: Modifies the value of the Haruhi Meter. The meter minimum is 0 (corresponding to 10%) and the meter maximum is 9 (corresponding to 100%).

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpHARUHI_METER_NOSHOW
data.value: Adds to the Haruhi Meter without showing the Haruhi Meter UI (the sound effects are still played). Unused in the game.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpHOLD
data.value: Stops script execution until input is received from the player.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpINIT_READ_FLAG
data.value: Seems to initialize read flags for the current script; however, it's utility is unknown as it is unused in the game.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpINVEST_END
data.value: Ends investigation mode and returns to the main visual novel format of the game. Automatically fades screen to black.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpINVEST_START
data.value: Starts investigation mode. Automatically clears most of the screen UI and then fades screen out to black and then back in from black.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpITEM_DISPIMG
data.value: Displays the specified item image. The item system is entirely unused in the game, so this command goes unused as well.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpKBG_DISP
data.value: Displays a particular "kinetic" (my word) background on the top screen. Must be of type KINETIC_SCREEN.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpLOAD_ISOMAP
data.value: Loads an isometric map for usage by INVEST_START.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpMODIFY_FRIENDSHIP
data.value: Modifies a character's "Friendship Level" by adding a particular value to it. The value can be positive or negative. Friendship levels start at 1, have a max of 64, and persist throughout a playthrough.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpNEXT_SCENE
data.value: Ends the scene and moves to the next one as listed in the Scenario item.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpOP_MODE
data.value: Suppresses the top screen UI, shows BG_KBG04 on the top screen, disables dialogue skipping, and marks the center of the screen as the position the Kyon chibi walks to, and sends the Kyon chibi out. Used only in the opening text crawl.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpPALEFFECT
data.value: Changes the color of currently displayed UI elements using a specified filter.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpPIN_MNL
data.value: Draws a dialogue line as monologue over all other dialogue. Undone by completing a chess game.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpREMOVED
data.value: Removed in the final version of the game (not referenced in any scripts.)

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCENE_GOTO
data.value: Goes to a particular scene. Note that this scene cannot be just any script file; it must be contained within the event table.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCENE_GOTO_CHESS
data.value: Behaves as SCENE_GOTO except that it's used to go to scripts that contain chess puzzles.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCREEN_FADEIN
data.value: Causes the screen to fade in.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCREEN_FADEOUT
data.value: Causes the screen to fade out.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCREEN_FLASH
data.value: Flashes the screen a specified color for a specified amount of time.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSCREEN_SHAKE_STOP
data.value: Stops screen shaking from a SCREEN_SHAKE command. (Used when the Duration parameter of said SCREEN_SHAKE is set to -1).

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSELECT
data.value:
Presents the player with a series of choices that branch the dialogue tree. Choices are defined in their own section and have IDs that correspond to labels set in the labels section. When a choice is chosen, this ID is used to select which script block will be jumped to.
SELECT cannot be used in the initial, unnamed script block.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSKIP_SCENE
data.value: Sets up the NEXT_SCENE command to skip a specified number of scenes as defined in the Scenario.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSND_STOP
data.value: Stops the currently playing sound. Unused in game.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpSTOP
data.value: Stops script execution and soft locks the game. Unused.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpTOGGLE_DIALOGUE
data.value: Shows/hides the dialogue box. Note that plenty of other commands already do one of these (e.g., DIALOGUE automatically shows the dialogue box).

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpTOPIC_GET
data.value: Gives the player a particular topic.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpTRANS_IN
data.value: Plays a transition from black into the scene.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpVGOTO
data.value: Goes to a specified script section if a specified conditional is true.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpWAIT
data.value: Waits a particular number of frames.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpWAIT_CANCEL
data.value: A command nearly identical to WAIT, but allows for the wait to be canceled with a button press or screen tap.

data.name: ScriptCommandVerbHelpBACK
data.value: When used in the initial script section, starts execution to the first script block. Otherwise, makes the script return to whatever called it (e.g. the puzzle phase) or returns you to the investigation phase.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpDisplayFromBottom
data.value: By default, tall CGs will display from the top. If this is checked, it will instead display from the bottom.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpScrollSpeed
data.value: The speed at which the background scrolls; higher is faster. Default is 1.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpSpriteLayer
data.value: The "layer" on which to display the sprite -- this determines which sprites appear on top of the others. Higher numbers will display on top of higher numbers.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpDontClearText
data.value: If set, the text box will not be cleared and the next text will be displayed immediately. This allows for cool effects where you can change things like the text entrance effect, voice font, etc. in the same box.
data.comment: Help tooltip for the "Don't Clear Text" parameter of the DIALOGUE command

data.name: ScriptCommandScreenParamFadeInLocationHelp
data.value: Should be the same as the previous SCREEN_FADEOUT command. In SCRIPT00 (the first fade of the scene), this must be Both screens for the fade to work properly.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpFadeOutColor
data.value: The the color type to use. Except for special transitions, it is generally recommended to use Custom Color as it provides the most flexibility.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpFadeCustomColor
data.value: This color will only be applied if you have selected "Custom Color" for the "Color" property below.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpFadeLocation
data.value: The screen to apply the fade to. Except for the initial fade in SCRIPT00, you must use Custom Color to fade both screens.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpShakeDuration
data.value: Set to -1 to shake the screen until the SCREEN_SHAKE_STOP command is executed. The game runs at 60 frames per second, so 60 frames is equivalent to 1 second.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpSelectConditional
data.value: If this is left blank, the option is always shown. Otherwise, this is a conditional value that if evaluated to true will display the option and will hide it if false

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterHelpSoundLoad
data.value: This must be checked when a sound is played initially. If a sound plays for a long time and you want to change its volume, uncheck this and set the crossfade time instead.

data.name: TypeToSearchHelp
data.value: Tip: Type to jump to an item in the dropdown!

data.name: ScriptEditorScript00NoMoveTip
data.value: SCRIPT00 must always be the first script section, so you can't move it.

data.name: BgmLoopStartHelp
data.value: BGMs always start from the very beginning. This is the position it will loop back to after it reaches the end loop marker if looping is enabled.

data.name: BgmLoopEndHelp
data.value: Once this position is reached, the BGM will loop back to the start loop position if looping is enabled.

data.name: ScriptCommandParameterFadePercHelp
data.value: If this is not set to the default value, the screen will not fully fade in/out. This should not be changed unless you are experimenting with a very specific effect.

data.name: ScriptCommandScreenParamFadeInColorHelp
data.value: Should be the same as the previous SCREEN_FADEOUT command. In SCRIPT00 (the first fade of the scene), this must be Black for the fade to work properly.

data.name: FramesToSecondsHelp
data.value: The game runs at 60 frames per second, so 60 frames is equivalent to 1 second.

data.name: ChessPuzzleEditorRemoveLimitHelp
data.value: The game's move counter only has sprites going up to five; however, if you're fine with glitched numbers and want to play a longer game of chess, you cancheck this box and have fun.

data.name: ScriptEditorDialogueSpriteEntranceHelp
data.value: The sprite entrance transition is necessary for making the sprite appear on the screen when first entering a scene. It plays before the dialogue is shown.

data.name: ScriptEditorDialogueSpriteExitHelp
data.value: The sprite exit transition is necessary for making sprites leave or move around on the screen. It plays after the dialogue has been advanced.

data.name: SystemTexturePaletteReplacementDisabledExtra
data.value: This system texture uses the common extra mode palette, so palette replacement has been disabled.

data.name: AboutDialogVersionString
data.comment: {0} denotes the version of the application as displayed in the about dialog

data.name: OggDecodeFailedMessage
data.value: Failed to decode provided ogg file; only Vorbis and Opus codecs are supported.

data.name: EmulatorLaunchFailedErrorMessage
data.value: Failed to start emulator. Check the logs for more information.
